intro: Leonohebe mooreae var. telmata, commonly known as the Tuatara's beard, is a rare and unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often purple-tinged foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and usually blue or violet, appearing in clusters during the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
